channel.title: Shop help
channel.description:
ok my show just fills up and the items ppl have sold to it dont go away how do i make it so they do
secound question how do i make the items in my show respawn slowly instead of just staying empty?[br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2007, 01:46:07 AM[/size][hr]cmon ppl plz tell me ill be ya friend !!! :D

item.title: Shop help

@bakatool wrote:

nope thats all good. If you wanna mess with changing something try changing the public void process() { inside ShopHandler.java thats a big timer thats updated should be updated 2 times every second.

item.title: Shop help
item.dc:creator: @doodooss doodooss
item.description:
@doodooss wrote:

ShopHandler() { for(int i = 0; i < MaxShops; i++) { for(int j = 0; j < MaxShopItems; j++) { ResetItem(i, j); ShopItemsSN[i][j] = 0; //Special resetting, only at begin ! } ShopItemsStandard[i] = 0; //Special resetting, only at begin ! ShopSModifier[i] = 0; ShopBModifier[i] = 0; ShopName[i] = ""; }would i mess with this?? just wondering and i changed that time thing didnt
do anything

item.title: Shop help
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

I think they work just lower the timers time from 45 seconds to like 20 seconds which should be from 90 to 60ish.

also make sure process is getting called by
shopHandler.process();
or
server.shopHandler.process();

somewhere… i havent touched it in a while idk yet just change 90 to 60 and wait for 20 seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Shop help
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

both questions are exactly the same problem

the making ppl’s item’s go away is cuz the timer is not working.
the respawn items slowly is cuz the timer is not working also.

go to ShopHandler.java and

look at
public static int MaxShowDelay = 90;

90 means… 45 seconds I think

make sure its like this
